fields.description: GUI does show objects in buckets with empty directory (//) paths, but fails to do any actions with those objects. The simples reproduction steps is to run euca-import-volume and navigate in the bucket to the parts. There is no way to download or do any actions with those upload parts.
fields.summary: GUI can't deal with objects that are stored with // in paths

comments.body: [~vasya], I'm not sure what "empty" paths means. In the related case, we had paths with double slash, but really unsure what an empty path is.
[~dkavanagh], this is the same case. I just called '//' an empty path. I renamed the ticked. The bug that was fixed covered presentation but not operations with objects in this edge case.

[~dkavanagh] [~kgill] I could reproduce this bug by running euca-import-volume <path to file> -f raw -b <bucket name> -z <availability zone> on QA shared setup #2 . I think this bug is safe to confirm now.
How does this differ from the GUI-1536 case? Does it sound urgent? I think throwing it on the backlog is OK.

[~dkavanagh] [~kgill] I would bump up priority on this one since euca-import-volume is one of the easiest ways to put an objects into a bucket, and accessing the URL link from the object detail  page is an easy way to  share that object. Therefore, to me, this bug seems like something our customers or potential customers would be likely to run into.

[~kgill] euca-import-volume can be used to import any file with intention to share it. Also, people might want to look at the manifest, which was [~vasya]'s use case.  Would it be possible to fix this in the current release?
[~jloza] what do you think, should the priority of this bug be higher?
I'll take this. I worked on the linked issue as well and I'm very interested to see how this is different.

[~alice], What path to file did you use to create the "//" ? Using a file in the cwd didn't cause the problem.

I tried w/ path of ../root//testfile_10MB0 and that generated a path element of ".." which when clicked, took me back to parent dir, so that is a different problem.

Using a path of .//testfile_10MB0 also caused an issue

Using /root//testfile_10MB0 created the empty folder in the path, but that works as per GUI-1936

[~dkavanagh] I used the following command: euca-import-volume ~/somefile.log -f raw -b test-path -z one

I attached a movie of the bug as seen in the bucket. I used Google Chrome as my browser.
Thanks, The movie helped! I didn't realize it was the object detail page that was the issue.

I think what's happening here is that boto collapses the double slash. I've seen this before when trying to create a key w/ double slash. We are clearly passing the right key into boto.
Here's some boto debug to show it got the right key, but then collapsed the slashes

2015-09-10 14:47:51 DEBUG path=/daktest/dfde884d-30a3-4a44-aa39-ed9390c01807//root/testfile_10MB0.manifest.xml/
2015-09-10 14:47:51,967 boto [DEBUG]:auth_path=/daktest/dfde884d-30a3-4a44-aa39-ed9390c01807//root/testfile_10MB0.manifest.xml/
2015-09-10 14:47:51 DEBUG auth_path=/daktest/dfde884d-30a3-4a44-aa39-ed9390c01807//root/testfile_10MB0.manifest.xml/
2015-09-10 14:47:51,967 boto [DEBUG]:Method: HEAD
2015-09-10 14:47:51 DEBUG Method: HEAD
2015-09-10 14:47:51,967 boto [DEBUG]:Path: /daktest/dfde884d-30a3-4a44-aa39-ed9390c01807/root/testfile_10MB0.manifest.xml/


Found the boto code, with possible workaround.
https://github.com/boto/boto/blob/develop/boto/connection.py#L618-L621
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1562
[~lnajjar]: Have you had a chance to review this ticket?  PR 1562 combined GUI-1993 with GUI-1994, so I'm blocked on merging that PR until GUI-1993 is UX reviewed.
PR 1562 merged

[~kgill], I had sent an email to [~dkavanagh] asking if the following message was related to his fix: 

"This XML file does not appear to have any style information associated with it. The document tree is shown below.
No KI entered for 4.2.

I was just able to perform sharing changes and the "make public" action on an object detail page where the breadcrumbs look like: /Buckets/daktest/af2820f0-d410-4dfa-8425-98124c8f8ec4//root//testfile_10MB0.part.0
[~kgill], after using your example import and other objects I already had with double/slash in the key, I cannot reproduce the error.

[~dkavanagh]: Log into shared setup #1 as eucalyptus/admin and attempt to make any of the objects at https://console-lb-000840838253.lb.c-04.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/buckets/testing-gui-1993/contents/foo//bar/d22529ad-e641-4d05-ae06-e904200c8253 public.
fix branch created.
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1663
PR 1663 merged
